verses.text: A prayer for help, and praise for its answer. ¶ of David.¶ Unto thee, O Jehovah, will I call: My rock, be not thou deaf unto me; Lest, if thou be silent unto me, I become like them that go down into the pit.
Hear the voice of my supplications, when I cry unto thee, When I lift up my hands [a]toward thy holy oracle.

footnotes.a: Or, toward the innermost place of thy sanctuary

verses.text:
Draw me not away with the wicked,
    And with the workers of iniquity;
    That speak peace with their neighbors,
    But mischief is in their hearts.

Because they regard not the works of Jehovah,
    Nor the operation of his hands,
    He will break them down and not build them up.

¶     Blessed be Jehovah,
    Because he hath heard the voice of my supplications.

Jehovah is their strength,
    And he is a stronghold of salvation to his anointed.

Save thy people, and bless thine inheritance:
    Be their shepherd also, and bear them up for ever.
